  20. open Mach
  21. open Format

  23. module Int = Numbers.Int
  24. module String = Misc.Stdlib.String

  26. ‌let function_is_assumed_to_never_poll func =
  27.   String.starts_with ~prefix:"caml_apply" func
  28.   || String.starts_with ~prefix:"caml_send" func

  30. (* These are used for the poll error annotation later on*)
  31. ‌type polling_point = Alloc | Poll | Function_call | External_call
  32. ‌type error = Poll_error of (polling_point * Debuginfo.t) list

  34. exception Error of error

  36. (* Detection of recursive handlers that are not guaranteed to poll
  37.    at every loop iteration. *)

  39. (* We use a backwards dataflow analysis to compute a mapping from handlers H
  40.    (= loop heads) to either "safe" or "unsafe".

  42.    H is "safe" if every path starting from H goes through an Ialloc,
  43.    Ipoll, Ireturn, Itailcall_ind or Itailcall_imm instruction.

  45.    H is "unsafe", therefore, if starting from H we can loop infinitely
  46.    without crossing an Ialloc or Ipoll instruction.
  47. *)

  49. ‌type unsafe_or_safe = Unsafe | Safe

  51. module Unsafe_or_safe = struct
  52. ‌  type t = unsafe_or_safe

  54. ‌  let bot = Unsafe

  56. ‌  let join t1 t2 =
  57.     match t1, t2 with
  58.     | Unsafe, Unsafe
  59.     | Unsafe, Safe
  60.     | Safe, Unsafe -> Unsafe
  61.     | Safe, Safe -> Safe

  63. ‌  let lessequal t1 t2 =
  64.     match t1, t2 with
  65.     | Unsafe, Unsafe
  66.     | Unsafe, Safe
  67.     | Safe, Safe -> true
  68.     | Safe, Unsafe -> false
  69. end

  71. module PolledLoopsAnalysis = Dataflow.Backward(Unsafe_or_safe)

  73. ‌let polled_loops_analysis funbody =
  74.   let transfer i ~next ~exn =
  75.     match i.desc with
  76.     | Iend -> next
  77.     | Iop (Ialloc _ | Ipoll _)
  78.     | Iop (Itailcall_ind | Itailcall_imm _) -> Safe
  79.     | Iop op ->
  80.       if operation_can_raise op
  81.       then Unsafe_or_safe.join next exn
  82.       else next
  83.     | Ireturn -> Safe
  84.     | Iifthenelse _ | Iswitch _ | Icatch _ | Iexit _ | Itrywith _ -> next
  85.     | Iraise _ -> exn
  86.   in
  87.   (* [exnescape] is [Safe] because we can't loop infinitely having
  88.      returned from the function via an unhandled exception. *)
  89.   snd (PolledLoopsAnalysis.analyze ~exnescape:Safe ~transfer funbody)

  91. (* Detection of functions that can loop via a tail-call without going
  92.    through a poll point. *)

  94. (* We use a backwards dataflow analysis to compute a single value: either
  95.    "Might_not_poll" or "Always_polls".

  97.    "Might_not_poll" means there exists a path from the function entry to a
  98.    Potentially Recursive Tail Call (an Itailcall_ind or
  99.    Itailcall_imm to a forward function)
  100.    that does not go through an Ialloc or Ipoll instruction.

  102.    "Always_polls", therefore, means the function always polls (via Ialloc or
  103.    Ipoll) before doing a PRTC.  This includes the case where it does not
  104.    perform any PRTC.

  106.    A note on Potentially Recursive Tail Calls
  107.    ------------------------------------------

  109.    Tail calls can create infinite loops, of course. (Consider a function
  110.    that tail-calls itself.)  But not all tail calls need to be flagged
  111.    as potential infinite loops.

  113.    We optimise by making a partial ordering over Mach functions: in
  114.    definition order within a compilation unit, and dependency
  115.    order between compilation units. This order is acyclic, as
  116.    OCaml does not allow circular dependencies between modules.
  117.    It's also finite, so if there's an infinite sequence of
  118.    function calls then something has to make a forward reference.

  120.    Also, in such an infinite sequence of function calls, at most finitely
  121.    many of them can be non-tail calls. (If there are infinitely many
  122.    non-tail calls, then the program soon terminates with a stack
  123.    overflow).

  125.    So, every such infinite sequence must contain many forward-referencing
  126.    tail calls.  These tail calls are the Potentially Recursive Tail Calls
  127.    (PTRCs).  Polling only on those calls suffices.

  129.    Several functions below take a parameter [future_funcnames]
  130.    which is the set of functions defined "after" the current function
  131.    in the current compilation unit.  The PTRCs are tail calls
  132.    to known functions in [future_funcnames], or tail calls to
  133.    unknown functions.
  134. *)

  136. ‌type polls_before_prtc = Might_not_poll | Always_polls

  138. module Polls_before_prtc = struct
  139. ‌  type t = polls_before_prtc

  141. ‌  let bot = Always_polls

  143. ‌  let join t1 t2 =
  144.     match t1, t2 with
  145.     | Might_not_poll, Might_not_poll
  146.     | Might_not_poll, Always_polls
  147.     | Always_polls, Might_not_poll -> Might_not_poll
  148.     | Always_polls, Always_polls -> Always_polls

  150. ‌  let lessequal t1 t2 =
  151.     match t1, t2 with
  152.     | Always_polls, Always_polls
  153.     | Always_polls, Might_not_poll
  154.     | Might_not_poll, Might_not_poll -> true
  155.     | Might_not_poll, Always_polls -> false
  156. end

  158. module PTRCAnalysis = Dataflow.Backward(Polls_before_prtc)

  160. ‌let potentially_recursive_tailcall ~future_funcnames funbody =
  161.   let transfer i ~next ~exn =
  162.     match i.desc with
  163.     | Iend -> next
  164.     | Iop (Ialloc _ | Ipoll _) -> Always_polls
  165.     | Iop (Itailcall_ind) -> Might_not_poll  (* this is a PTRC *)
  166.     | Iop (Itailcall_imm { func }) ->
  167.       if String.Set.mem func future_funcnames
  168.          || function_is_assumed_to_never_poll func
  169.       then Might_not_poll  (* this is a PTRC *)
  170.       else Always_polls    (* this is not a PTRC *)
  171.     | Iop op ->
  172.       if operation_can_raise op
  173.       then Polls_before_prtc.join next exn
  174.       else next
  175.     | Ireturn -> Always_polls
  176.     | Iifthenelse _ | Iswitch _ | Icatch _ | Iexit _ | Itrywith _ -> next
  177.     | Iraise _ -> exn
  178.   in
  179.   fst (PTRCAnalysis.analyze ~transfer funbody)

  181. (* We refer to the set of recursive handler labels that need extra polling
  182.    as the "unguarded back edges" ("ube").

  184.    Given the result of the analysis of recursive handlers, add [Ipoll]
  185.    instructions at the [Iexit] instructions before unguarded back edges,
  186.    thus ensuring that every loop contains a poll point.  Also compute whether
  187.    the resulting function contains any [Ipoll] instructions.
  188. *)

  190. ‌let contains_polls = ref false

  192. ‌let add_poll i =
  193.   contains_polls := true;
  194.   Mach.instr_cons_debug (Iop (Ipoll { return_label = None })) [||] [||] i.dbg i

  196. ‌let instr_body handler_safe i =
  197.   let add_unsafe_handler ube (k, _) =
  198.     match handler_safe k with
  199.     | Safe -> ube
  200.     | Unsafe -> Int.Set.add k ube
  201.   in
  202.   let rec instr ube i =
  203.     match i.desc with
  204.     | Iifthenelse (test, i0, i1) ->
  205.       { i with
  206.         desc = Iifthenelse (test, instr ube i0, instr ube i1);
  207.         next = instr ube i.next;
  208.       }
  209.     | Iswitch (index, cases) ->
  210.       { i with
  211.         desc = Iswitch (index, Array.map (instr ube) cases);
  212.         next = instr ube i.next;
  213.       }
  214.     | Icatch (rc, hdl, body) ->
  215.       let ube' =
  216.         match rc with
  217.         | Cmm.Recursive -> List.fold_left add_unsafe_handler ube hdl
  218.         | Cmm.Nonrecursive -> ube in
  219.       let instr_handler (k, i0) =
  220.         let i1 = instr ube' i0 in
  221.         (k, i1) in
  222.       (* Since we are only interested in unguarded _back_ edges, we don't
  223.          use [ube'] for instrumenting [body], but just [ube] instead. *)
  224.       let body = instr ube body in
  225.       { i with
  226.         desc = Icatch (rc,
  227.                        List.map instr_handler hdl,
  228.                        body);
  229.         next = instr ube i.next;
  230.       }
  231.     | Iexit k ->
  232.       if Int.Set.mem k ube
  233.       then add_poll i
  234.       else i
  235.     | Itrywith (body, hdl) ->
  236.       { i with
  237.         desc = Itrywith (instr ube body, instr ube hdl);
  238.         next = instr ube i.next;
  239.       }
  240.     | Iend | Ireturn | Iraise _ -> i
  241.     | Iop op ->
  242.       begin match op with
  243.       | Ipoll _ -> contains_polls := true
  244.       | _ -> ()
  245.       end;
  246.       { i with next = instr ube i.next }
  247.   in
  248.   instr Int.Set.empty i

  250. ‌let find_poll_alloc_or_calls instr =
  251.   let f_match i =
  252.       match i.desc with
  253.       | Iop(Ipoll _) -> Some (Poll, i.dbg)
  254.       | Iop(Ialloc _) -> Some (Alloc, i.dbg)
  255.       | Iop(Icall_ind | Icall_imm _ |
  256.             Itailcall_ind | Itailcall_imm _ ) -> Some (Function_call, i.dbg)
  257.       | Iop(Iextcall { alloc = true }) -> Some (External_call, i.dbg)
  258.       | Iop(Imove | Ispill | Ireload | Iconst_int _ | Iconst_float _ |
  259.             Iconst_symbol _ | Iextcall { alloc = false } | Istackoffset _ |
  260.             Iload _ | Istore _ | Iintop _ | Iintop_imm _ | Ifloatofint |
  261.             Iintoffloat | Inegf | Iabsf | Iaddf | Isubf | Imulf | Idivf |
  262.             Iopaque | Ispecific _ | Idls_get | Icompf _) -> None
  263.       | Iend | Ireturn | Iifthenelse _ | Iswitch _ | Icatch _ | Iexit _ |
  264.         Itrywith _ | Iraise _ -> None
  265.     in
  266.   let matches = ref [] in
  267.     Mach.instr_iter
  268.       (fun i ->
  269.         match f_match i with
  270.         | Some(x) -> matches := x :: !matches
  271.         | None -> ())
  272.       instr;
  273.   List.rev !matches

  275. let instrument_fundecl ~future_funcnames:_ (f : Mach.fundecl) : Mach.fundecl =
  276.   if function_is_assumed_to_never_poll f.fun_name then f
  277.   else begin
  278.     let handler_needs_poll = polled_loops_analysis f.fun_body in
  279.     contains_polls := false;
  280. ‌    let new_body = instr_body handler_needs_poll f.fun_body in
  281.     begin match f.fun_poll with
  282.     | Error_poll -> begin
  283.         match find_poll_alloc_or_calls new_body with
  284.         | [] -> ()
  285.         | poll_error_instrs -> raise (Error(Poll_error poll_error_instrs))
  286.       end
  287.     | Default_poll -> () end;
  288. ‌    let new_contains_calls = f.fun_contains_calls || !contains_polls in
  289.     { f with fun_body = new_body; fun_contains_calls = new_contains_calls }
  290.   end

  292. ‌let requires_prologue_poll ~future_funcnames ~fun_name i =
  293.   if function_is_assumed_to_never_poll fun_name then false
  294.   else
  295.     match potentially_recursive_tailcall ~future_funcnames i with
  296.     | Might_not_poll -> true
  297.     | Always_polls -> false

  299. (* Error report *)

  301. ‌let instr_type p =
  302.   match p with
  303.   | Poll -> "inserted poll"
  304.   | Alloc -> "allocation"
  305.   | Function_call -> "function call"
  306.   | External_call -> "external call that allocates"

  308. ‌let report_error ppf = function
  309. | Poll_error instrs ->
  310.   begin
  311.     let num_inserted_polls =
  312.       List.fold_left
  313.       (fun s (p,_) -> s + match p with Poll -> 1
  314.                       | Alloc | Function_call | External_call -> 0
  315.       ) 0 instrs in
  316.       let num_user_polls = (List.length instrs) - num_inserted_polls in
  317.       if num_user_polls = 0 then
  318.         fprintf ppf "Function with poll-error attribute contains polling \
  319.         points (inserted by the compiler)\n"
  320.       else begin
  321.         fprintf ppf
  322.         "Function with poll-error attribute contains polling points:\n";
  323.         List.iter (fun (p,dbg) ->
  324.           begin match p with
  325.           | Poll -> ()
  326.           | Alloc | Function_call | External_call ->
  327.             fprintf ppf "\t%s at " (instr_type p);
  328.             Location.print_loc ppf (Debuginfo.to_location dbg);
  329.             fprintf ppf "\n"
  330.           end
  331.         ) instrs;
  332.         if num_inserted_polls > 0 then
  333.           fprintf ppf "\t(plus compiler-inserted polling point(s) in prologue \
  334.           and/or loop back edges)\n"
  335.       end
  336.   end

  338. let () =
  339.   Location.register_error_of_exn
  340.     (function
  341.       | Error err -> Some (Location.error_of_printer_file report_error err)
  342.       | _ -> None
  343.     )
